Description: Rim and body sherd of North Ionian pottery eye cup; glaze fired red-brown; interior glazed, with two added red bands lined in white; exterior: top of rim glazed; below, part of large eye with arching eyebrow and vertical lines on the left; two thin bands under the handle zone; trace of worn decoration on lower wall, perhaps void rays; creamy white slip on the outside.
Bibliographic references: Möller 2000 / Naukratis, Trade in Archaic Greece (p. 256, no. 5)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.464)
